Description:
Searches for Coverage resources. Coverage resources correspond to coverage records in Epic.

In Epic, coverage records exhibit the following characteristics:

  • The patient-level coverage list represents all possible insurances that could be billed for services. A patient might have a long list of possible coverages that are applicable only for specific services. Examples include third party liability, workers' comp, black lung insurance, Medicaid for ESRD, Medicare, commercial, and others.
  • For any specific visit, an account record will indicate which coverages will be used for that visit.
  • A single visit-level account may have multiple coverages attached. Coverage filing order indicates which is billed first.
  • Coverages may be specific to service area. For this reason, if you are searching across multiple service areas, a patient might have what appears to be duplicate coverages.

This resource typically should not be used to determine which coverages are relevant for recent or upcoming visits and services. Instead, it returns all coverages that are potentially applicable to a patient.

This resource respects patient-level break-the-glass checks as configured in Epic. Audit events are logged to the patient audit trail when a coverage is accessed by this resource.

beneficiary.Name: beneficiary
beneficiary.Description: Either the beneficiary or the patient must be specified in the search request. If both are specified, they must match.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Either the beneficiary or the patient must be specified in the search request. If both are specified, they must match.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Human-readable description of the type and value.

type.Name: type
type.Description: Type of class such as 'group' or 'plan.'

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description:
Coverage ID.

This element also includes the UZOVI code for Dutch organizations.

insurance-address.Name: extension
insurance-address.Description: The address to which the claim will be sent. It can either be the payer, guarantor account, plan, or coverage address. Which address to use is stored in Claim Mail Code (CVG item 120).

insurance-payment-type.Name: extension
insurance-payment-type.Description: Whether a coverage is Medicaid or Medicare. This element will be present only if the coverage is either Medicaid or Medicare.

order.Name: order
order.Description: Filing order of this coverage for a patient. This isn’t specific to a visit and might not be accurate for a particular visit.

payor.Name: payor
payor.Description: The payer name. Starting in the November 2021 version of Epic, this is a reference to the Organization resource.

qualifying-patient-access.Name: extension
qualifying-patient-access.Description: Boolean indicating if coverage is a qualifying coverage based on Patient Access API configuration in the Tapestry Profile.

relationship.Name: relationship
relationship.Description:
Patient (beneficiary) relationship to subscriber.

These values can be customized if the Epic organization has defined custom values for Patient Relationship to Subscriber.

Otherwise, the following default values are used:

  • self
  • spouse
  • child
  • employee
  • unknown

status.Name: status
status.Description:
Financial Resource Status Code. The following values are supported:

  • active
  • cancelled
  • draft
